newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean yields end lower, Ssangyong woes subside.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean yields end lower, Ssangyong woes subside.

text.p: Yields on benchmark three-year corporate bonds closed sharply lower on Thursday as fears of more corporate failures subsidised, brokers said.
They said relatively large amount of blue chip issues also fuelled buying interest.
Dealers said the market was also excited by a government decision to supply 1.5 trillion won to banks and merchant banks to ease liquidity tightened by troubles of the Kia Group.
They said relatively large amount of blue chip issues on Thursday also boosted buying interest.
Anticipated tax payments and corporate month-end money demand, which had pushed the corporate yields higher, had been already reflected in the market.
Kang Yung-gee at Hyundai Securities said he expected the yields to fall to 11.80 soon.
